snippet: By late summer, 1,700 conductors will be using the Apple devices to scan tickets electronically and do much more.
abstract: Amtrak passengers will be able to print tickets or load a special bar code on their smartphone screens for conductors to scan, and conductors will be able to keep track of passengers on board, all by using iPhones; system should be at least partly in place by the end of summer. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Old-school train conductors are finally ready to give up their hole punchers to try something new: the iPhone. Amtrak, the government-owned corporation that oversees the nation's railroad train services, has been training conductors since November to use the Apple handset as an electronic ticket scanner on a few routes, including from Boston to Portland, Me., and San Jose, Calif., to Sacramento.

headline.main: Amtrak Enlists iPhones as a Service Tool
